answerText: condensation reactions[10] In this reaction, a base abstracts the alpha proton of a Michael reaction adduct to yield an enolate, which then attacks a ketone in an intramolecular aldol reaction. Finally, elimination of hydroxide produces a six-membered ring enone.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Washington, Dartmouth B, GW A | 20 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this class of reactions where a small molecule, typically water, is released. Walter Dieckmann has one of these named after him, which is pretty luck since all he had done was the intramolecular version of the Claisen type.
